content.body:
> <@shuyuguo:matrix.org> is privacy in scope of TG3? i recall some contention around that

Yes, observation of confidential information that shouldn't be know is a violation
content.formatted_body:
In reply to @shuyuguo:matrix.org
is privacy in scope of TG3? i recall some contention around that
Yes, observation of confidential information that shouldn't be know is a violation

content.body: e.g. in SES it cannot observe the user language via toLocaleString, otherwise a program can fake it to have a deterministic behavior in CI because CI has locale "en-US" but actually a bad program when the user locale is "ja-JP"
i don't understand how that example relates to proposal reviews
ðŸ¤” oh proposal review? I think there isn't too much privacy related things will be added to the language in the future. It's different than privacy review for Web APIs
